docs.lead_paragraph: The Yankees started their practice today with an eventful pop-up drill. Each of the starters took his position while the pitchers took turns pretending to throw off the mound. After their delivery, a coach would put a ball in a pitching machine aimed skyward.
docs.abstract: Mike Mussina couldn't bear to watch his fellow pitchers during Friday's eventful pop-up drill. (Robert F. Bukaty/Associated Press) The Yankees started their practice today with an eventful pop-up drill. Each of the starters took his position while the pitchers took turns pretending to throw off the mound. After their delivery, a coach would put a [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: Professor Minsky laid the foundation for the field by demonstrating the possibilities of imparting common-sense reasoning to computers.
docs.abstract: Prof Marvin Minsky, noted computer scientist and pioneer in artificial intelligence research, dies at age 88; won 1970 Turing Award and co-founded MIT Artificial Intelligence Project.
docs.snippet: Professor Minsky laid the foundation for the field by demonstrating the possibilities of imparting common-sense reasoning to computers....

headline.print_headline: Marvin Minsky of M.I.T. Is Dead at 88; Early Explorer of Artificial Intelligence
headline.main: Marvin Minsky, Pioneer in Artificial Intelligence, Dies at 88

docs.lead_paragraph: Judging from its many turns in the spotlight this year, the term “Big Data” has entered the mainstream.
docs.abstract: Steve Lohr Unboxed column contends that judging from its many turns in the spotlight in 2012, the term Big Data has sprung from the confines of technology circles into the mainstream; points out Big Data is a shorthand label that typically means applying the tools of artificial intelligence, like machine learning, to vast new troves of data beyond that captured in standard databases.
docs.snippet: Judging from its many turns in the spotlight this year, the term “Big Data” has entered the mainstream....

headline.print_headline: Amid the Flood, A Catchphrase Is Born
headline.seo: How Big Data Became So Big - Unboxed
headline.main: How Big Data Became So Big

docs.lead_paragraph: Google parent Alphabet Inc said Amit Singhal, the longtime chief of its Internet search business, will leave the company and be replaced by the head of the technology giant's artificial intelligence business.

docs.abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Monday's selection includes hackers who can enter your hotel room, a hate app and citizen journalism after the Aurora, Colo., shootings.
